; Thu, 12 Oct 2023 14:52:02 +0800 ‘We lie on the floor till someone buys us’: shocking allegations of UAE agencies’ abuse of domestic workershttps://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/oct/12/we-lie-on-the-floor-till-someone-buys-us-shocking-allegations-of-uae-agencies-abuse-of-domestic-workers
;;2023-10-12T06:00:00Z;
;
;;家政工人的代理广告在照片旁边展示了女性的个人信息。
;

;寻找工作的女性根据《卫报》看到的采访和文件，阿联酋的家政工人声称，他们在肮脏的住所中遭到拘留和虐待，而招聘人员则通过应用程序和社交媒体平台将他们出售给家庭雇主。

;

;通过几年来进行的一系列采访，来自东非和菲律宾的 14 名妇女讲述了她们在招聘机构的经历，包括她们被拒绝提供食物、被囚禁和受到暴力对待。

;

;《卫报》还看到了证据表明，一位专家表示，这些妇女正以一种让人想起奴隶制的“剥削性”方式进行销售，雇主对黑人家庭佣工的服务收取较低的费用，并被告知他们甚至不需要为他们提供合适的卧室。

;

;这些妇女的证词罕见地洞察了家政工人机构住宿的生活是什么样的，因为移民在不确定的情况下等待雇主雇用她们。这个过程可能需要几个月的时间，女性经常会根据雇主的一时兴起被送回机构。

; ;

; “我们一落地，[机构工作人员]就拿走了我们的护照。然后我们就去了这个房子。一间小房间里睡着我们八九个人。不允许使用手机，”受阿吉曼酋长国一家机构招募的菲律宾人玛格丽塔*说道。 “我们一起躺在地板上，直到有人买下我们。”

;

;受访者都是在自己的国家招募到阿联酋工作的，其中一些是由社区成员充当经纪人，另一些则是通过回应广告在Facebook上。许多人希望在抵达迪拜后立即找到雇主。相反，他们被锁在机构的住处长达几个月，没有工资来养活家人。

;

;28 岁的 Angelica Pine 在 2019 年被一家机构关押了四个月。她声称她遭到一名女员工的暴力袭击。

;

;“她脾气很坏。她踢我，把我扔进她的房间，揪我的头发，打我的脸，还拿走了我的私人物品，比如手机。”派恩说道。

;

;《卫报》曾与其中一些女性进行过交谈。长达三年。一些人在接受大使馆的遣返援助后现已返回祖国，并能够讲述自己的经历。然而，一些人表示，他们认识其他被困在招聘机构住宿中的女性。

;

;玛丽*，34 岁，来自肯尼亚，被困在阿联酋，她告诉《卫报》，她想离开她的雇主。她每天工作超过 18 个小时，没有休息日，每月的工资相当于 327 美元（270 英镑），这让她精疲力竭。她声称雇主在她的卧室里安装了摄像头，她说很难换衣服，因为她知道他们可以看到她。她请求招聘人员帮助她离开，但表示他们指责她“制造戏剧”。

;

;“我仍然害怕该机构，因为我仍然在他们的领导下，”玛丽说，她没有获得职位在开始工作之前签订合同。 “我们正在受苦。”

; ;

;阿联酋招聘机构经常在网上宣传他们在网上出售的女性。 《卫报》在 Facebook、Instagram 和 TikTok 上发现了数十个此类广告，其中展示了女性的照片及其个人信息，潜在买家在页面上留下评论并询问价格。

;

;所有这些广告由已获得阿联酋政府颁发经营许可证的招聘机构发布，据称这些机构被认证为保护雇主和家庭工人权利的公司。

;

;“工作人员强迫你穿上“戴上头巾，然后他们给你拍一段视频，”27 岁的肯尼亚人 Nia 说道。 “如果有人喜欢你的个人资料，他们就会来到办公室，然后你就可以进行现场采访。你别无选择；你需要一份工作。” Nia 最终在迪拜的一处院子里待了三个月，她的机构曾在 2021 年关押过该处妇女。 “当天送货”，或者声称非洲员工不需要卧室？

;
; ;James Lynch，FairSquare;
; ; ;

;女佣。 cc 是一家获得许可的招聘机构，拥有一个应用程序和网站，人们可以在其中选择、订购女佣并为其付款，甚至无需先与她见面。

;

;“在网上获得全职女佣或女佣签证5分钟。随时取消，”该网站指出。 “你当天就能找到女仆。观看女佣视频并雇用您最喜欢的女佣。我们会在当天用 Uber 打车给您。”

;

;它在常见问题页面上进一步宣传了其服务的便利性：“零法律责任。女佣保留在我们的签证上，因此您永远不必担心任何法律后果。如果出现任何问题（例如女佣离家出走、怀孕），我们负责处理任何诉讼或前往警察局，而不是您。”

;

;用户每月为每个女佣支付的价格是根据种族、该网站称，雇主对黑人女佣的服务收费较低。它指出“菲律宾人每月 3,500 迪拉姆（952 美元）”和“非洲人每月 2,700 迪拉姆（735 美元）”，但没有透露女佣实际收到的工资金额。

; ;

;女佣的工作和生活条件也是由种族决定的。该网站指出，菲律宾女佣需要自己的卧室睡觉，而非洲女佣则不需要。

;

;“很难知道从哪里开始：根据种族和国籍来定价是最糟糕的事情，承诺通过 Uber 当日送达服务将一名女性送到你家，还是声称非洲员工不需要卧室？”人权非营利组织 FairSquare 联合主任詹姆斯·林奇 (James Lynch) 在审查了《卫报》向他提出的事项后说道。

;

;“像这样的贬低、商品化和剥削人的行为让人回想起奴隶贸易， Lynch 表示：“这种做法是在网上进行，而不是在实体市场进行。”

;

;另外，位于阿布扎比的另一家机构 Leadership Tadbeer（有时称为 Leadership Tadbeer）在 TikTok 和 Instagram 上为女佣做广告。在 Instagram 上，广告中的女性来自印度尼西亚、埃塞俄比亚和斯里兰卡。他们的服务售价为每月 1,100 迪拉姆至 1,400 迪拉姆。

;

;“在阿联酋，根据国籍和个人详细信息为家庭佣工做广告的做法长期以来一直是一种做法，”说人权观察组织的罗斯娜·贝古姆。 “这表明当局在保护家庭工人权利方面做得很少。”领导层发言人塔德比尔表示：“关于你强调的问题，在阿联酋，我们的人力资源部长已经组织了这种关系赞助商、工人和代理人之间的关系。

;

;“关于工资，别忘了还有免费住宿、免费食物、免费私人工作人员、电话津贴和良好的健康保险。你可以看到在阿联酋这里，200多个民族安全地生活在一起。这里的每个人都互相尊重。”

;

;与此同时，总部位于迪拜的 Al Forsan Tadbeer 机构在 Instagram 和 Facebook 上发布的广告列出了女佣的姓名、年龄、婚姻状况、护照号码、国籍、孩子数量和体重，并在照片旁边用“白皙”、“黑色”等词语描述他们的“肤色”。

;

;“招聘过程中的非人性化做法与更广泛的虐待之间存在密切联系，”说林奇。 “简而言之，招聘机构和雇主越不承认家庭佣工的人性，他们就越没有义务以尊严和尊重的方式对待他们。”

;
;

;;相关：;;菲律宾就业机构阿联酋政府发言人告诉《卫报》：“阿联酋对工作场所虐待行为采取零容忍政策。阿联酋法律还禁止对举办关于其权利和举报虐待方式的研讨会的员工进行任何形式的虐待。

;

;“每当个人和/或实体的行为违反阿联酋法律时，我们都会进行全面调查。被发现有过错的人员将根据阿联酋法律法规追究责任。

;

;“阿联酋劳动法规定所有员工必须有带薪休假、休息日、医疗保险、住宿、膳食、财产他们的个人身份证件，并获得免费的法律支持。阿联酋继续采取积极、坚决的步骤，实施法律、法规和监测措施，以改善其劳动力的工作条件并解决任何差距。”

;

;Maids.cc 和 Al Forsan 没有对多个问题作出回应请求发表评论。

;

;* 为了保护受访者的身份，姓名已更改。

; Thu, 12 Oct 2023 14:52:02 +0800 Record-setting US cave diver dies during underwater excursionhttps://www.theguardian.com/sport/2023/oct/12/brett-hemphill-cave-diver-texas
;;2023-10-12T05:00:00Z;
;
;;一名棕色头发、浅蓝色眼睛的中年白人，身穿灰绿色领衬衫，看上去自信满满站在蕨类植物墙前，进入镜头。
;

;;Brett Hemphill; 2013 年，他潜入德克萨斯州 Phantom Springs 水下洞穴系统 40 多层深处，创下了全国纪录，打破了他五年前创下的纪录。

;

;上周末，他的潜水同事将他的尸体从水中拉了出来。就在这位 56 岁的潜水员在一次探险中失踪几天后，同样的危险迷宫也出现了。

;

;亨普希尔的命运引起了紧密团结的国际潜水界的高度赞扬，他们知道他坚持遵守最高的安全标准。他领导的喀斯特水下研究 (KUR) 小组表示，寻找和恢复亨普希尔的努力已经让位于对他的致命事故的调查，但答案需要时间。

;

;“当我们找到答案时亨普希尔 (Hemphill) 的 KUR 同事安迪·皮特金 (Andy Pitkin) 在一份声明中写道：“我们将收集所有信息并对其进行分析，然后就该事件发布一份声明，回答每个人的问题。” “在那之前，请给我们一些时间来接受他的损失。”

;

;亨普希尔的死亡情况引起了全世界对;幻影泉; 位于德克萨斯州西部的洞穴。这位纪录创造者一生中的大部分时间都在那里和其他地方进行洞穴潜水，然后意外地留下了他的妻子、孩子和其他近亲。

;

;亨普希尔在 14 岁时就对洞穴着迷。他参加了一次干燥的游览——徒步探索洞穴而不是潜水——并发现了该地点以前未被发现的部分，如;DiveMagazine.com; 告诉了这一点。

;

;“我一直喜欢探索”，包括在房子周围，Hemphill ;2021 年在 Divesoft TV 上说道;。“我从来都不是一个满足于看电视的孩子。如果我骑自行车，我就是在跳溪……你知道的——任何事情。”

;

;后来他从印第安纳州搬到了佛罗里达州，并获得了水肺潜水证书，因为他认为这将完全打开水肺潜水领域的大门。

;

;“水肺潜水对我来说绝对是一种工具，”Hemphill 说。

; ;

;从 20 世纪 90 年代开始，Hemphill 帮助探索和调查美国一些最深的洞穴系统，很少有人遇到过。亨普希尔的工作激励人们要求保护和保存他绘制和记录的洞穴。

;

;他和他在拥有近 30 年历史的组织 KUR 的团队打破了美国深水下洞穴记录，达到了2008 年，在佛罗里达州的威基瓦奇温泉 (Weeki Wachee Springs) 深度达 407 英尺（124 米）。

;

;根据威基瓦奇温泉 (Weeki Wachee Springs) 网站上的传记，2008 年的探险队将威基瓦奇温泉 (Weeki Wachee Springs) 确立为美国最深的自然形成温泉。 KUR 总部位于佛罗里达州戴德市。

;

;五年后，Hemphill 和 KUR 在 Phantom Springs 潜水至 465 英尺（142m），打破了之前的记录。亨普希尔的团队深入了近 1.5 英里（2.4 公里），进入了被誉为美国最深、最精致的水下洞穴之一。

;

;这些旅行凸显了亨普希尔探索世界各地洞穴的职业生涯，包括巴哈马群岛和墨西哥的尤卡坦半岛。

;

;尽管给参与者带来了身体和精神上的损失，亨普希尔仍继续从事自己的职业。

;

;“我对人们这么说……我不”亨普希尔在 2021 年表示，“当我回到 20,000 英尺高的山洞里时，不要再考虑我的孩子和妻子。”“这些不是你想要考虑的事情。”

;

;相反，他建议他专注于手头的任务，因为知道自己拥有足够的技能和设备，可以在许多人比作外太空的环境中保证自己的安全，这让他感到很安慰。

; ;

;Hemphill 的最后一次潜水是在 10 月 4 日上午 10 点 45 分左右，与 Pitkin 一起开始的。两人回到了 Phantom Springs，这次 Hemphill 到达了深度达到令人震惊的 570 英尺（174 米）。

;

;KUR 表示，视频显示 Hemphill 在那个时刻将一根引导绳绑在一块岩石上，团队就分开了。

;

;“我开始来自英国的皮特金告诉佛罗里达新闻台 ;WTVT;。“但他从来没有这样做过。”

;

;亨普希尔的消息传开后当他在幻影泉失踪后，几位专业潜水员前往那里并联手寻找他。 KUR 表示，克鲁斯于周日从超过 450 英尺（137 米）深的地方打捞出了他的尸体。

;

;位于德克萨斯州拉伯克的法医办公室计划对亨普希尔进行尸检，以确定他的死亡原因。 。他的家人发起了;GoFundMe 活动;，旨在帮助支付丧葬费用。

;

;同时，如果潜水官员确认亨普希尔最后一次出现在 570 英尺处，他将创下超过 100 英尺的美国最终水下潜水纪录。

;

;“他是一位真正的探险家和先驱，”艾美奖得主说道。亨普希尔的水下电影制片人贝基·卡根·肖特 (Becky Kagan Schott) 向 ;坦帕湾时报;。

;

;与亨普希尔一起制作了几部纪录片的肖特补充道：“潜水界今天失去了一位伟大的个人。”

; Thu, 12 Oct 2023 13:22:01 +0800 Roberto Saviano faces defamation verdict for remark about Giorgia Melonihttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/12/roberto-saviano-faces-defamation-verdict-for-remark-about-giorgia-meloni
;;2023-10-12T04:00:59Z;
;
;;罗伯托·萨维亚诺
;

;罗马法官准备在针对诽谤罪的刑事审判中做出判决意大利反黑手党作家罗伯托·萨维亚诺 (Roberto Saviano) 称总理乔治亚·梅洛尼 (Giorgia Meloni) 为“私生子”。自畅销书《蛾摩拉》出版以来一直受到警方保护，如果周四在罗马刑事法庭被判有罪，他将面临最高三年的监禁。

;

;全球作家协会国际笔会表达了对萨维亚诺的声援。并敦促 Meloni 撤销指控。

;

;Pen 的传播和活动经理 Sabrina Tucci 正在罗马参加听证会，她说：“事实上，这起诉讼是由意大利总理 Meloni 发起的，对作家和记者来说是一个危险的警告，表明他们的言论可能会导致长期的法律纠纷、财务紧张、情绪困扰，甚至可能入狱。

;

;“反对政府的意见不应等于触犯法律。”

;

;此案可以追溯到 2020 年 12 月的一次电视采访中，萨维亚诺在采访中严厉批评了梅洛尼和她的极右翼领导人马泰奥·萨尔维尼 (Matteo Salvini) 对慈善运营的救援船只的尖刻言论在地中海。

;

;被要求对一名来自几内亚的六个月大婴儿在海难中死亡一事发表评论，;萨维亚诺;：“所有这些废话（关于非政府组织）、海上出租车、（针对移民的）游轮。我只能说：混蛋，你怎么能这样？梅洛尼、萨尔维尼：混蛋。”

;

;当时，去年 10 月上台的梅洛尼政府将这位备受瞩目的作家兼记者描述为“连续仇恨者”，并补充说她“厌倦了目睹了这种令人厌恶的暴利行为”。

;

;萨维亚诺曾受到另外两名现任政府部长的诽谤诉讼，其中包括副总理萨尔维尼，前内政部长，他于 2018 年起诉提交人，因为他提到他被称为“il ministro della mala vita”——在社交媒体上的一篇帖子中，大致意思是“黑社会的部长”。此案仍在审理中。

;

;今年 5 月，萨维亚诺赢得了梅洛尼政府文化部长根纳罗·桑朱利亚诺 (Gennaro Sangiuliano) 于 2020 年提起的民事诽谤案。

;

;在意大利，诽谤可受到以下处罚：六个月至三年的监禁。意大利最高法院此前曾敦促立法者重写法律，认为此类案件中的监禁时间违宪。

;

;2022年，意大利在无国界记者组织世界新闻自由指数中排名第58位。

; Thu, 12 Oct 2023 09:52:02 +0800 Nasa shows off first asteroid samples delivered by spacecrafthttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/oct/11/nasa-asteroid-samples-osiris-rex
;;2023-10-11T18:07:41Z;
;
;;An artist's rendering made available by Nasa depicts Osirix-Rex contacting the asteroid Bennu.
;

;Chunks of a 4.6bn-year-old asteroid brought to Earth last month show evidence of high levels of carbon and water, Nasa said on Wednesday as the space agency revealed preliminary findings from its pioneering ;Osiris-Rex mission;.

;

;Scientists have been analyzing the samples from the asteroid Bennu since they were dropped off by a spacecraft flyby of the Utah desert on 24 September. Principal investigator Dante Lauretta of the University of Arizona, Tucson, told reporters at Houston's Johnson Space Center (JSC) they were “scientific treasure”.

;

;The carbon-rich asteroid fragments, the largest such haul ever recovered, “will help scientists investigate the origins of life on our own planet for generations to come”, Nasa administrator Bill Nelson said.

;

;The researchers also announced the mission that brought the samples to Earth after a ;three-year journey; of almost 60m miles was even more successful than first anticipated.

; ;

;The original goal of the mission was to collect a little more than 2oz (60g) of asteroid material that would be ;studied by curation experts; in new clean rooms at JSC ;built specifically for the mission;.

;

;But when the canister lid was first opened, scientists discovered “bonus asteroid material” covering the outside of the collector head, canister lid and base. There was so much extra material, Nasa said, it delayed the detailed process of collecting and containing the primary sample.

;

;“It's been going slow and meticulous,” Lauretta said, telling the press conference that black dust and particles were scattered around the outside edge of the chamber. “This is already scientific treasure”.

;

;So far, only a “quick-look” analysis has taken place, including imaging by a scanning electron microscope, infrared measurements, X-ray diffraction and chemical element analysis.

;

;X-ray computed tomography was also used to produce a three-dimensional computer model of one of the particles, Nasa said, highlighting its diverse interior. It was this early look that provided evidence of abundant carbon and water in the sample.

;

;Nelson stressed the research to date provided only a preliminary assessment, and that the real work was about to begin.

;

;“Almost everything we do at Nasa seeks to answer questions about who we are and where we come from. Missions like Osiris-Rex will improve our understanding of asteroids that could threaten Earth while giving us a glimpse into what lies beyond,” he said.

;

;“The sample has made it back to Earth, but there is still so much science to come… science like we've never seen before.”

;

;The rocks and dust from the asteroid will be studied “for decades to come”, according to a Nasa press release accompanying the reveal. They would, the statement said, “offer insights into how our solar system was formed, how the precursor materials to life may have been seeded on Earth, and what precautions need to be taken to avoid asteroid collisions with our home planet”.

;

;“The bounty of carbon-rich material and the abundant presence of water-bearing clay minerals are just the tip of the cosmic iceberg,” Lauretta said.

;

;“These discoveries, made possible through years of dedicated collaboration and cutting-edge science, propel us on a journey to understand not only our celestial neighborhood but also the potential for life's beginnings. With each revelation from Bennu, we draw closer to unraveling the mysteries of our cosmic heritage.”

;

;During the next two years, scientists will continue “characterizing” the samples. At least 70% of them will remain at JSC for further research by experts from the US and worldwide. Additional samples will be loaned to the Smithsonian Institution, Space Center Houston and the University of Arizona for public display.

;

;Meanwhile, the Osiris-Rex mission, managed by Nasa's Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland, continues. After dropping off the Bennu samples, the spacecraft resumed its fight towards an encounter with the asteroid Apophis in 2029 when it makes its ;closest approach to Earth;.

;

;Apophis had been thought to pose a threat to Earth in 2068, but was ;removed from the European Space Agency's “risk list”; two years ago.

;

;A member of Thailand's national breakdancing team has spoken about one of the lesser known challenges of the sport – hair loss.

;

;At the Asian Games in Hangzhou, China, where breaking – known in the media as breakdancing – debuted this year, Thailand's national team was asked about the kinds of support performers need. They said there was a lack of facilities for training in Thailand, meaning people have to practise in parks or shopping malls.

;

;But team member Kantapon Rodsaart said there was another issue that he would like to ask for help with: hair loss.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Meet the young stars of UK breakdancing aiming for Olympic glory at Paris 2024;

;
;

;“I have to wear a hat while dancing to protect my hair because it's thin. The more I dance, especially on a rough floor, the more my hair falls out. So, I would like to ask for support or sponsorship for hair treatment,” he said.

;

;Kantapon and his teammates laughed as he spoke, but he added that this was actually a genuine problem.

;

;“I am serious about this, it would boost my confidence. Currently, I have to wear two hats. If I don't wear it, you will see a shine from my head,” Kantapon said.

;

;According to a ;study published in the Journal of Dance Medicine and Science; this year, a form of alopecia known as “headspin hole” or “breakdancer overuse syndrome” is unique to breakers. People who practise more than three headspin sessions a week were significantly more likely to have hair loss, the study said.

;

;It also found that breakers were less likely to seek medical help.

;

;Breakdancing's debut at the Asian Games in Hangzhou comes less than a year before it will appear as the ;newest Olympic sport at Paris next year;. B-Boys and B-Girls, as performers are known, competed in front of a panel of judges and thousands of spectators.

;

;The men's gold medal was won by Japan's Shigeyuki Nakarai, while the women's gold medal was won by China's Liu Qingyi on Saturday.

;

;Kantapon later shared a clip of his media interview on Facebook, with the caption “I'll keep sharing until a sponsor appears” – referring to his search for hair treatment sponsorship – along with a laughing emoji.

;Joe Biden is under pressure from fellow Democrats to refreeze ;$6bn of Iranian oil revenues; released last month as part of a ;prisoner exchange deal; amid accusations that Iran played a key role in last weekend's deadly attack on Israel by the Palestinian group Hamas.

;Although the White House has accused Tehran of being “broadly complicit” due to its long-term financial and logistical support for Hamas, US officials have said multiple pieces of intelligence indicate that Iran's leadership had no prior knowledge of the devastating onslaught launched from Gaza, and that it may have caught them by surprise.

;;The northern spotted owl perched on a tree stump
;

;Canadian cabinet ministers have rejected a plea by the country's environment minister to ;save an endangered owl;, casting doubt on the species' survival in the coming years.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'All I see are ghosts': fear and fury as the last spotted owl in Canada fights for survival;

;
;

;The Wilderness Committee environmental advocacy group ;announced; on Wednesday that federal ministers had rejected a request for an emergency order to protect the northern spotted owl – a request submitted by environment minister ;Steven Guilbeault;.

;

;The Wilderness Committee has for years lobbied the federal government to intervene in the destruction of spotted owl habitat.

;

;In February 2023, Guilbeault ;said; ;the spotted owl was facing “imminent threats to its survival”; and told environmental groups he would recommend an emergency order to block further destruction of its habitat in British Columbia.

;

;Guilbeault concluded that logging must stop in an area of the Spô'zêm Nation territory, including the Spuzzum and Utzlius watersheds, as well as a further 2,500 hectares (6,200 acres) of forest habitat that are at risk of logging.

;

;In order for the emergency order to go into effect, the federal cabinet must accept Guilbeault's recommendation, after it consults affected First Nations.

;

;After an eight-month delay, however, other cabinet members of the governing Liberal party, which have touted their commitments to biodiversity protection, have rejected the order.

;

;Before industrial logging in south-west British Columbia, there were nearly 1,000 spotted owls in the old-growth forests. Now, only ;one wild-born owl remains;. Two captive-bred owls released last fall were found dead in May. Two more captive-bred owls were released into the wild earlier this year.

;

;Biologists have told the Guardian the species could recover with adequate protections to key habitat areas, all of which are old-growth forests.

;

;The Wilderness Committee, represented by environmental law charity Ecojustice, will be in court on 18 October to determine if Guilbeault's eight-month delay in recommending this emergency order to cabinet adheres to requirements under the federal ;Species at Risk Act;.

;

;“The minister has been required by law since January to recommend an emergency order,” Ecojustice lawyer Andhra Azevedo said in a statement. “Instead, the minister spent months 'engaging' with [British Columbia], while [British Columbia] made no new commitments to protect habitat and instead continued to approve logging. To state the obvious, we have emergency orders under the Species at Risk Act to respond to emergencies – what we've seen by the minister and now cabinet is nowhere close to an emergency response.”
